data.event: Possibly settled as early as 1780, Falmouth was laid out by John Waller (1758-1823) and formally established by the state assembly in 1793.

event.title: was incorporated as a city in 1856

data.event: It was incorporated as a city in 1856.
In 1964, the Licking River reached 47 feet (19 feet above flood stage) and left much of the town under water.
On April 23, 1968 a tornado leveled many homes in the town.

event.title: March 2, 1997, a major flood on the Licking River again left

data.event: On March 2, 1997, a major flood on the Licking River again left the town crippled.
